newsitem.title: DUBAI: India says 179 haj pilgrims missing, 123 injured.
newsitem.headline: India says 179 haj pilgrims missing, 123 injured.

text.p: India's ambassador to Saudi Arabia said on Monday 179 Indians were still missing after a fire that killed over 300 Moslem haj pilgrims last week.

"Some 179 are missing and 123 are injured," Mohammad Hamad Ansari told Reuters by telephone from the kingdom. "The injured figure is constantly changing because we keep coming up with more and more information."
Ansari said there was still no exact figure for the number of Indians killed in the fire, which swept through a key pilgrimage site near the Moslem holy city of Mecca in Saudi Arabia on Tuesday.
"This is exactly what we are really anxious to find out," he said. About 80,000 Indians performed the haj this year.

"Our teams in Mecca are doing a head count room by room, building by building," he said. "We know exactly where the people are staying in Mecca. We are also going around mortuaries and hospitals as well. In mortuaries the situation is more difficult because of charred bodies."
Witnesses said many victims were burned, others suffocated from fumes while some were crushed by a stampede. Saudi Arabia has said 343 people died and over 1,500 were injured.
